intro: Tylophora iringensis, commonly known as the Iriŋe Tylophora, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are follicles that release seeds with a tuft of hair, aiding in wind dispersal. Tylophora iringensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
